titles.title: The eLife research article

person_name.affiliation: Department of Production, eLife, Cambridge, United Kingdom
Department of Production, eLife, Cambridge, United Kingdom

jats:abstract.jats:p:
This is the abstract. This article will describe the eLife article and the process. An abstract can contain any formatting, such as italics, bold, superscript, subscript or small caps. MathML is also allowed:
m
p
m
= 0
.

eLife does not structure abstracts into sub headings expect in a clinical trial article, but the abstract can have multiple paragarahs. The sub DOI is always .001 as it is the first asset in any article. I have added an unmatched > bracket as this has been an issue for PubMed deposits in the past.
If this was a clinical trial the clinical trial details would be listed at the end of the abstract:

eLife digest are now optional and not every research article will contain one. These are layman abstracts, designed for non-specialists in this field to be able to understand this article, as well as the general public.
Here is paragraph 2 of the digest.

SKN-1 from the JASPAR CORE database

titles.title: Figure 1. Single figure: The header of an eLife article example on the HTML page. In the PDf this is represented as a single column.
Figure 2. Figure with figure supplements. In the PDF this asset box will take full column width.
titles.subtitle: This is the basic information provided about an article. Figure 1 shows an expanded view (Kok et al., 2015; National Institute of Mental Health, 1990).
